alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Douglas (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 02 at 4:39AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Carroll and Douglas Counties through 515 AM EST... At 439 AM EST, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Temple to near Ranburne, and moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Douglasville, Carrollton, Villa Rica, Temple, Bowdon, Mount Zion, Whitesburg, Lithia Springs, Bowdon Junction, Hannah, Bill Arp, Chapel Hill, Seaton Lake, Fairplay, Clem, Abilene, Winston, Lake Val-Do-Mar, John Tanner State Park and Treasure Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 AM EST for north central and northwestern Georgia.
